Articles.Content:
Well anyways, im working on a grand tour ship that can land a single kerbal (at least) on every single body except the sun and jool.  It will use staging (since its my first ever attempt at such a task and i dont want to make it overly difficult to do hence the cheap abuse of staging) but im already starting to consider making a second single stage style model.

Now im very well aware that it is impossible to make it work without detaching and then reattaching the actual landers, so that will be fine for me.  I have a tylo rated lander that weighs under 4.6t, so in theory i can do every single planet besides eve (laythe gives me trouble as the thing is horrifically unaerodynamic but it has over 4000dV so i should be able to just ignore drag forces with so much range) with that one craft.  Its not as fuel efficient as bringing separate landers like a small ion model for the ultra-low grav worlds, but i think it makes more sense to have just that one lander (1 ton dry mass is nothing) and then enough fuel for around 5 refuels to be on the safe side (it has 2000 dV when at like 1/4 fuel so every planet but tylo, duna, and laythe should be doable at 1/4 fuel),

Now my real issue comes into play with my eve lander.  I dont actually have any good designs that work in the new aero, my best attempt is something like 30t (and that is only the lander portion).  Id like to know what the lightest lander that works on eve (and carries 1 kerbal) is and roughly what the composition is (like what engine it uses, roughly what the fuel layout is) to make it work.  I absolutely dont need it to be single stage or anything since i plan to do eve first and get rid of all of that dry mass asap, but right now its apparent that my original lander design is just too heavy to use for a single stage grand tour.  Any help in this area is appreciated as my experience with eve if fairly lousy (ive made 2 successful return trips thusfar, one in 0.24, one in 1.0).

Also, id like to know what is the best way to make a SSTO that can actually drag everything i need up with me (i have alot of experience with smaller SSTOs, my best one managed to land on laythe, bop, and pol then return to kerbin on its own) as i have no experience with heavy lifting SSTOs.  Im pretty much going to need the absolute maximum payload fraction i can get and its probably going to need to lift around 100t with it to give me enough fuel to run the NTRs and to drag the eve and tylo landers with me as well as a small rcs sevice droid (no way im putting RCS on the landers as im already just barely capable of doing tylo with it and every gram counts with something so small and light), and ofc the few refuels for teh lander, and well at least 1 crew cabin for the kerbals to live in (i have nothing against sending a kerbal down to a planet in a service bay, but in space i have some standards for long ranges).

Also worth mentioning is that im attempting this 100% bone stock (aside from visual mods and the ability to alter fuel types in tanks so i can for example have 2.5m LF only tanks) and with absolutely no IRSU or refueling (if its deemed impossible i may settle for one single refuel once i get the mothership in LKO but absolutely nothing past that).  Hopefully this isnt just a dream that will never happen, but until then i could use some help with this, especially the eve lander and the actual mothership itself.
